alert.note: Alert for Fort Bend (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 27 at 4:17AM CDT until April 28 at 12:40AM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Texas, including the following counties, Brazoria, Fort Bend and Harris. * WHEN...Until 515 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 416 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Rainfall rates up to 1.16 inches in 15 minutes have been observed. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Northwestern Pearland, Sugar Land, Missouri City, eastern Rosenberg, Stafford, Bellaire, West University Place, First Colony, Fresno, Town West, Greenway / Upper Kirby Area, Astrodome Area, University Place, Afton Oaks / River Oaks Area, Neartown / Montrose, Macgregor, Midtown Houston, Meadows Place, Southside Place and Thompsons. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
